title: Full stack Engineer
description:
**ID:** 
 753527151 – 1150
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm
   

  

**Length:** 
 2024-04-22 till 2025-04-30
   

  

**Scope:** 
 100%
   

  

**Background**
 This role is within our Global Online Digital team, which is using digital technologies to reinvent the experience of becoming a Volvo customer. There’s no reason the experience of buying a car should be painful and difficult – it should be as enjoyable and exciting as actually having a new car. That is our mission.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 You will be developing and maintaining a unified global Checkout experience for Volvo Cars that will be scaled to use in 100+ markets across the globe. We are responsible for ensuring a seamless cart to order transition for the customers in their online buying journey. This includes and not limited to displaying the customer’s cart along with the selected financial option, collecting customer data, ensuring legal compliance, providing a logged in experience, collecting payment, displaying order tracking, etc. Your responsibilities will include rapid development of prototypes/concepts, and regular product development and support.
   

  

 You should have a start-up experience where you have quickly developed prototypes and catalyzed product development in a fast-paced, fluid environment. It’s a plus, if you have also worked in bigger matrix organizations. You are a hands-on developer with both front-end and back-end experience. You are experienced with agile development and a champion of software development standard methodologies and best practices.
   

  

**You And Your Skills**
 To succeed in this role, you need to have:
   

  

* Minimum of 5 years of work experience as a Full stack engineer
* Experience in working with Java Spring Boot
* Experience in re-writing application from one tech stack (Java) to another (Typescript/JavaScript).
* Experience in Typescript programming and in building UIs with HTML and CSS.
* Expertise in React.js and demonstrated experience in Next.js framework.
* Experience in using one or more cloud providers like AWS or Azure. Someone who has experience in building accessible and performant websites.
* Experience in working with common CI/CD tool set to ensure continuous code delivery to production.
* Experience with headless content management systems.
* Excellent understanding of Service Oriented Architectures.
* Experience in working with ecommerce checkout and integrating various payment platforms (STRIPE, DIBS, Paypal, Klarna, etc).
* Finally, share passion for cars and developments in the auto industry.
* Good to have – Experience in ecommerce


**On-call requirement : Yes 24\*7. One week every 4/5 weeks.**
**Soft Skills**
 Self-motivated, go-getter, driven, a keen eye to detail, have a business values mindset.

title: Software Developer

The team is responsible to secure that the product under development is quality secured. You are proactive with a go get attitude, a team player that believes in the power of teams working together and in team collaboration, a problem solver, and a flexible team player. title: Full stack developer (JavaScript) with DevOps experience
Software Engineer (Scala), Supply and Demand Team
description:
**Job Description**
 At the large scale of the Wolt business, our operational efficiency benefits greatly from having automation for managing supply (how many courier partners are online) and demand (how many orders are being placed by customers). For us supply balance is a clear win-win situation, but it takes an entire team to make sure that this is possible. 💪 To succeed even better with supply balance, we are adding one more Backend Engineer to our new Supply and Demand team!
   

  

 Supply and Demand team’s mission is to make Wolt cities efficient for our customers, merchants and couriers, as well as making running the cities smooth for our operations people. This is done by building tools and features that help achieve balance between supply (number of Courier Partners online) and demand (home delivery orders from consumers) by surfacing the forecasts to our Courier Partners in the Courier App and Wolt operations, as well as creating ways to dynamically influence supply and demand. As a backend engineer you will have a chance to work on topics around, for example, courier engagement and activation bonuses. That can be fun and rewarding for several reasons:
   

  

* This field encourages innovative approaches and experimentation. You can try out new methodologies to see what works best.
* You often collaborate with various teams such as applied science, analytics, product management, and operations.
* Designing systems to optimize courier activation and bonuses involves solving complex logistics and machine learning problems.
* The need for real-time solutions means you often work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.


 At the moment, the team consists of two frontend developers, several backend engineers and applied scientists as well as the engineering team lead and product lead. The main programming languages on the team are Python, Scala, and TypeScript (React) and since the team also works closely with Applied Scientists, this is a great chance to learn a lot about machine learning if you have a knack for it!
   

  

 This role can be based in one of our tech hubs in Helsinki, Stockholm, or Berlin or you can work remotely anywhere in Finland, Sweden, Germany, or Estonia. Read more about our remote setup here.
   

  

**Our humble expectations**
 👉 You have solid experience designing, building, and integrating quality software (microservices) in Scala on a large scale within a complex domain, with strong focus on event-driven approach where the decisions need to be made in an online way.
   

  

 👉 You have knowledge of AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, observability (DataDog or similar tools) and data storage, both SQL and noSQL databases. We are actively using multiple solutions: postgresql, dynamodb, mongo, redis.
   

  

 👉 You’re a dedicated person who is pragmatic with a positive attitude, who doesn't shy away from going outside of their comfort zone, and demonstrates curiosity and willingness to keep continuously learning.
   

  

 👉 You’re comfortable working with real-world data and its different nuances.
   

  

 So, TL;DR if you have several years of experience in dealing with the back end of the house, can’t wait to learn new things, have an interest in tackling scalability challenges and building some cool stuff, then be sure to drop us a line! 📫
   

  

**Next Steps**
 💯 Overall our product organization consists of a team of over 800 people at Wolt. We aim to build none other than the best-in-the-world engineering team here.
   

  

 💙 You’ll get to work in a company culture where we take ownership beyond the obvious, do common things uncommonly well, we think big but stay humble, do right by people, we treat others kindly and justly, recognise that if we don’t learn, we won’t stay still but fall behind, and keep in mind that Luke was Yoda’s greatest achievement.
   

  

 🙌 Join us for an exciting journey! The compensation will be a negotiable combination of monthly pay and DoorDash equity. The latter makes it exceptionally easy to be excited about our company growing and doing well, as you’ll own a piece of the pie.
   

  

 For any further questions about the position, you can turn to Product+ Talent Acquisition Partner - Lina Muncyte (lina.muncyte(at)wolt.com).

title: Senior Frontend Developer
description:

 ,

 ,

 ,

**Preferred Qualifications/Skills**

**Experience Level**

title: Software Engineer (.NET)
description:
**The team today**
 Software is the core of our business at Lime and there is no gap between engineers and business. We are a small, ambitious, and autonomous (mainly remote) development team consisting of a mix of mid to senior engineers who primarily work with the .NET stack. We meet regularly with our Product Managers and decide what is essential to the product and how it should evolve.
   

  

 Being part of a Lime Go Engineering team will give you a lot of freedom and we guarantee no code monkey business.
   

  

 Every engineer at Lime is a problem solver who strives to understand how everything fits together. We do pragmatic solutions to hard problems, a good mix of freedom and responsibility, and most importantly – we have a great time at work! We are encouraged to come up with new ideas and experiment a lot. We think long-term and our ambition is to write clean and maintainable code. Our engineers take ownership of architecture and automated testing.
   

  

 We always stick to the “best tool for the problem” approach – we listen to industry trends with interest, but evaluate if something is right for us. We do things that matter to our customers and maintain a vision to stay on the right path.
   

  

 We are following a lightweight and agile process called ShapeUp. It looks a lot like Scrum, but is just working better, at least for us! ;) If you’re curious to learn more we recommend you read this blog article from one of our Product Owners.
   

  

**The job**
 We are seeking a skilled and experienced .NET Software Engineer to join our team in developing our cutting-edge, data-driven CRM platform. Our goal is to enhance customer communication by automating repetitive sales tasks, and we need a passionate engineer to help us achieve this.
   

  

 Are you a .NET expert who excels at building robust and scalable APIs? Do you have a deep understanding of C#, ASP.NET Core, and the .NET Framework ecosystem? Or perhaps you thrive in environments that leverage Docker, AWS, and CI/CD pipelines to streamline development and deployment processes? If so, we have an exciting opportunity that aligns with your skills and interests!
   

  

 We are looking for a .NET Framework Software Engineer who shares our vision of creating a next-generation product that redefines CRM solutions. Join us in our mission to innovate, build, and support a product that we can be proud of, using the latest .NET technologies to deliver exceptional value to our customers.
   

  

**Requirements**
**Skills & Requirements**
* More than three years of professional working experience as a Software Engineer.
* Design, develop, and maintain robust APIs using C# and ASP.NET Core, .NET Framework.
* Collaborate to define, design, and ship new features.
* Write clean, scalable, and maintainable code following best practices.
* Participate in code reviews, providing and receiving constructive feedback.
* Excellent oral, written, and English communication skills.
* Being able to plan your work and use/apply agile ceremonies (standups, retros, etc.).


**Nice to have**
* Experience in running/hosting software in production environments.
* Experience working with Octopus Deploy platform.
* Experience working with Docker.
* Experience with React.
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field.


**What We Offer**
* A stable and calm working environment.
* Ergonomic workplace equipment.
* Computer with your favorite OS.
* Promote personal skill development through various activities.
* A hybrid work model with a possibility of working from home.


**The process, step by step**
 We do not have a deadline for this recruitment, but as we process applications continuously, why wait? No time like the presence. Apply now!
   

  

* First off, you will get on a screening call with a person on the team. You might also meet one or multiple members of the team.
* Then you will have an interview.
* Get a technical assignment to show off your skills.
* After that, you will have an in-depth interview.
* Finally, you get to meet our CEO (Nils) for the final interview.


 If possible, we want to combine some of the steps above into one batch, so you will become a Limer as fast as you want!
   

  

 See you soon :)
   

  

**Let’s GO!**

title: Senior Backend Developer (.NET)
description:
MAJORITY is a groundbreaking all-in-one digital financial service app that includes an FDIC-insured account, Visa® Prepaid card, money remittance, and international calling. We are built for migrants, by migrants.
   

  

 Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are following their dreams, love or new experiences, more and more of us are leaning towards new environments. Our purpose at MAJORITY is to empower the amazing, the brave, and the talented and help them achieve all of their ambitions.
   

  

 We believe that everyone deserves the same opportunity to succeed. Our mission is to provide migrants the tools to thrive in their new country.
   

  

 We are a diverse group of people from over 40 different countries that come together every day and we’re looking for others driven by the same desire to create meaningful products that bridge cultural and geographic distances
   

  

 MAJORITY is looking for a Senior Backend Engineer (.NET) to join its Engineering team. This is a full time, in-person position based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**About MAJORITY Backend**
 We’re a diverse bunch of skilled software developers with a passion for technical excellence. We strive to create innovative solutions to the many varied business problems that we are presented with. We work hard, deliver fast, are continually learning and have fun along the way. With a team of 12 backend developers we have built a system of nearly 60 microservices with a million lines of C# code. Our business is growing fast and therefore so is our need to continually scale the system to meet the growing number or users and transactions.
   

  

* We have a modern technical platform. Recently upgraded to .Net8.
* We have a microservice architecture, fully in C#. built on a solid foundation of base functionality like observability, DI, messaging etc.
* We have a high pace of development, shipping major new features frequently.
* We have leadership who understands and prioritizes technical work.
* We work in a domain (fintech) where correctness matters. We have very high uptime and correctness requirements. No payments should fail, and no cent can be lost!


****Key Responsibilities****
* Design, develop and maintain microservices built with .NET Core
* Write clean code with proper test coverage to support CI/CD workflows
* Contribute in design and architecture decisions within the team and across the organization
* Develop scalable, performant, and reliable systems
* Participate as a team member in agile deliveries
* Identify bugs and bottlenecks and resolve issues efficiently


****Requirements****
* You have 10+ years of experience working with modern backend development practices, with focus on .NET Frameworks and C#.
* You have good experience in cloud environments
* You have good experience working with SQL databases
* You are familiar with working with microservices & event driven architecture
* You have an understanding and interest in building and maintaining microservices running in Kubernetes
* You have experience with build tools and services such as AzureDevops


****About you****
* You're smart and you get stuff done
* You are ambitious, have a positive energy and always find a solution
* You can prioritize speed without neglecting quality and understand that speed is a competitive advantage
* You have a strong sense of ownership and accountability
* You are eager to learn from others and share what you know
* You dare to make decisions and learn from your mistakes
* You can reason through the trade-offs to make correct decisions for the benefit of the organization
* You have great communication skills in English


 Looking to be challenged? To work in an environment where your opinions are welcome and you’re constantly learning? To have a real impact on a meaningful project? To work with the latest technologies and to help shape the technology direction of the organization? Then we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

 We are MAJORITY. We are international, ambitious, kind, and inclusive. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Developer Support Engineer for Data Calling

description:
*Learnster is a cutting-edge learning management system committed to revolutionizing how organizations approach employee development. Our human-centered approach blends innovative technology and AI with a dedication to empowering individuals and fostering learning cultures. Learnster comprises 45 engaged individuals, 200+ customers, and users across 30+ countries.* 




  





*Join us on our trailblazing journey to reshape the future of workplace individual learning!* 




  





**Job description** 




  





 Are you a senior back-end developer with a devops mindset? Do you enjoy building scalable SaaS-products using Python and AWS? If so, you might be exactly the one we're looking for!
 



  





 We're on the hunt for a senior back-end developer who wants to join us on our quest to help employees of our customers in their individual learning and growth journeys! We believe that you're a skilled engineer with a passion for technology and a drive to solve customer problems. We believe that you have a DevOps mindset where you care about the entire lifecycle of a solution, from ideation to development and deployment, and that you do that with open eyes and a learning mindset.
 



  





**Your role will include** 




  





 As a back-end developer at Learnster, you’ll be involved in the whole development lifecycle, where you contribute with everything from ideation and solution design to development, testing and deployment.
 



  





 You'll do this in close collaboration with other developers, designers and product managers since we believe that the best solutions come when people with different skills and background work together finding the best solutions.
 



  





**To thrive in this role you'll have the following skills and experience** 




  




* **Back-end development experience:** 
*Experience as a back-end developer, with a strong portfolio of solutions developed using Python and AWS.*
* **Python Development:** 
*Solid experience in Python development, specifically with the Django framework.*
* **Database design and development:** 
 Experience using both relational and non-relational databases and experience writing SQL code to retrieve and modify data.
* **AWS Solution Development:** 
*Experience in designing and implementing solutions on AWS, leveraging both AWS managed services and cloud-agnostic technologies.*
* **DevOps Mindset:** 
*A strong understanding of DevOps principles, with a focus on the entire lifecycle of a software solution. This includes a keen interest in why we build solutions, how we build them, and ensuring they perform optimally once deployed.*



  





**What We Offer** 




  




* *An exciting journey in a scale-up with strong investors*
* *Flexible work arrangements (remote/on-site)*
* *Health and wellness benefits*
* *Continuous learning opportunities within a vibrant, innovative team*
* *Six weeks of paid vacation plus 3 extra free days per year*
* *A culture that values diversity and promotes personal development*



  





 We look forward to meeting you!
 



  





*Join a fast-growing and awarded SaaS company, where you will play a key role in shaping Learnster’s future.* 




  





*At Learnster, you will work with passionate and ambitious colleagues, ready to take ourselves, our team, and the company to the next level!* 




  





 Please send your application in if you think that you would be a good fit for this position and if you think that Learnster might be a place for you!
 



  





 We look forward to meeting you!

title: Utvecklare Identitet-, åtkomst- och behörighetsstyrning
description:
Vill du jobba i en komplex miljö med en samhällsviktig funktion som ligger i teknikens framkant? Här finns stora möjligheter för dig som vill utvecklas både på djupet och bredden inom ett eller flera områden. Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats med stor flexibilitet i vårt arbetssätt. Var med och gör samhället möjligt!
   

  

**Om jobbet**
 Vi söker nu en utvecklare till sektionen inom området Identitets-, åtkomst- och behörighetsstyrning (IAM). Tillsammans med ditt team ansvarar du för arkitektur, utveckling och underhåll av vår plattform för Identitets-, åtkomst- och behörighetsstyrning samt tillhörande tjänster. Just nu har vi påbörjat arbetet med att utveckla lösningen för vårt privata moln för att kunna erbjuda tjänsterna till fler myndigheter där samhällsnyttan är i fokus.
   

  

 Vår plattform är baserad på Opentext Identity Manager. Vår tekniska miljö består av Linux (RHEL) och Windows. Vi använder katalogtjänster som eDirectory och Windows Active Directory.
   

  

 Skatteverkets kultur kännetecknas av ett agilt arbetssätt med högt i tak och en öppen dialog för förändring och utveckling. Du kommer att tillhöra ett agilt team, där varje person har en expertkunskap inom området. Sektionen är en del av IT-säkerhetsenheten på Skatteverkets IT-avdelning och du kan vara placerad antingen i Sundbyberg eller Västerås.
   

  

 Hos oss får du möjlighet till ständig utveckling och lärande i arbetet. Du har kunniga kollegor som du utbyter erfarenheter med och du kan utveckla både bredd och spets hos oss. Tack vare att vi är en stor IT-organisation kan vi erbjuda goda möjligheter till intern rörlighet. Det är viktigt för oss att du har balans mellan jobb och fritid och vi erbjuder bland annat flexibel arbetstid. Vi erbjuder också mycket goda semestervillkor samt goda tjänstepensionsvillkor och förmåner för dig som är förälder. Du får en friskvårdstimme i veckan och friskvårdsbidrag.
   

  

 Här kan du läsa mer om hur det är att jobba med IT hos oss och ta del av vad några av våra medarbetare berättar om sina jobb: Jobba med IT hos oss
   

  

**Om dig**
 För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. I arbetet är gott omdöme och förståelse för rättssäkerhet och säkerhet viktigt. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.
   

  

 I det här jobbet ska du:
   

  

* ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande
* kunna driva utvecklingsaktiviteter från start till mål enligt uppsatta processer och kriterier
* förstå vikten av att, samt kunna skapa relationer med andra team för att nå de uppsatta målen
* ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker, vara flexibel och öppen för förändringar
* kunna analysera informationsflöden, se samband, mönster och göra avgränsningar
* agera medvetet och professionellt utifrån en god självinsikt
* uttrycka dig väl i tal och skrift på svenska


 Du ska även ha:
   

  

* relevant utbildning inom IT alternativt flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av utveckling och underhåll av lösningar för Identitets-, åtkomst- och behörighetsstyrning
* arbetslivserfarenhet av utveckling och underhåll av lösningar för Identitets-, åtkomst- och behörighetsstyrning
* arbetslivserfarenhet av arkitektur och design av lösningar för Identitets-, åtkomst- och behörighetsstyrning
* arbetslivserfarenhet av Linux


 Det är önskvärt att du har kunskap om och erfarenhet av en eller flera av följande: Opentext Identity Manager, katalogtjänster, relationsdatabaser, Windows Server, och Java eller JavaScript. Det är även önskvärt att du har arbetat utifrån agila metoder.
   

  

**Bra att veta**
 Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.
   

  

 När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sundbyberg | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/435 | Kontakt: Per Hjälmdahl, Sektionschef 010-5749860, Asal Wennergren, hr-specialist 010-5741953, | Facklig företrädare: Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2024-10-30 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-11-27

title: Cloud Software Application Developer 753527409
description:
**Let’s Create the Future Together**
 At Volvo Cars, we’re on a mission to make people’s lives less complicated. We design our services around people, and we innovate to provide mobility that is personal, sustainable, and safe. Do you want to join us?
   

  

**Who We Are**
 ART Car Cloud Platform is situated within the Department Software Digital in Engineering. Our vision is to provide a secure and global connected experience for car cloud services.
   

  

 This we do through enabling world class cloud services to contribute to the overall connected experience.
   

  

 We build, provide, and operate a highly secure run-time ecosystem for functions and applications serving the connected car, and their users. We aim to optimize functional and organic growth by utilizing standard cloud technologies with high level of synergies and re-use. With our car cloud solution, we provide cloud infrastructure, platform services & core components to support development and DevOps by providing tools for fast feedback & built-in quality.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 You will be part of an empowered agile DevOps team that strives for continuous learning and improvements. You and your team will define, build, test, deploy, maintain & operate highly secure applications serving connected cars and their users within the product area of Position & Map Services.
   

  

 You will collaborate with your Product Owner to ensure the right functionality is being developed as well as estimate the size and complexity of the work to be able to plan upcoming sprints. You will determine and maintain the technical design in our area within the given architectural guidelines.
   

  

 You will work with modern tools, micro services-oriented architecture, and new interesting technologies. On an everyday basis you’ll have the opportunity to learn from your peers, influence how we work and develop great things.
   

  

 Your team is situated in our office in Lindholmen. However, our ART has a hybrid setup with teams and colleagues throughout the world spanning from Gothenburg & Lund in Sweden to Europe, US and China.
   

  

**Tech We Use Daily**
 Java
   

  

 Spring, Spring Boot
   

  

 Docker, Kubernetes (K8s)
   

  

 PostgreSQL, Redis, Cassandra
   

  

 Splunk
   

  

 Kafka, JMS, ActiveMQ-Artemis
   

  

 GitLab, Grafana, Prometheus, PagerDuty, ArgoCD,
   

  

 GIT, Jira,
   

  

 Agile (Scrum, Kanban), Scaled Agile, DevOps
   

  

 WebService (REST/gRPC), Junit Testing, Maven
   

  

**Do You Fit the Profile**
 We believe you have at least 5 years of experience with Java development. You probably have a BSc degree or higher in computer science or equivalent.
   

  

 Preferably you have experience with Spring-framework, DevOps, test automation and system monitoring, and technologies such as Kubernetes, Kafka, PostgresSQL, REST/gRPC and JMS/AMQP.
   

  

 Previous experience in handling car-related information to the cloud, to cars, to mobile apps and to partners, is highly valued.¬¬
   

  

 We also think you have understanding in agile development methodology principles (e.g., Scaled Agile, Scrum, Lean, Kanban) and have worked in product teams before.
   

  

 Since Volvo Cars is a global organization, we see that you are fluent in the English language. For you to fully enjoy this opportunity, we believe that you have a genuine interest in working and developing within a product area. You embrace teamwork, collaboration and are eager to learn and develop new competences. We also expect you to be on top of technology evolution within software development and provide new ideas to continuously improve the product and our processes.
   

  

**Location** 
 : Göteborg
   

  

**Length** 
 : 2024-08-19 till 2024-12-31
   

  

**Scope** 
 : 100%

We provide tailored solutions to meet unique business needs and challenges, working closely with our clients to streamline and improve their sales, service, marketing, or CPQ processes. Our expertise lies in implementing solutions across leading SaaS platforms such as Salesforce, Microsoft, HubSpot, Tacton, and more. With 70 colleagues across 5 countries, we offer flexible solutions to businesses of all sizes.

title: Software Engineer: Lead Engine Team
description:
At EasyPark, we love cities. We love them for work, for play, and everything in between. That’s why our vision is to make cities more livable! EasyPark Group is a global company and a true leader in its domain. There is a clear ambition to quickly grow in coverage and offer our services to more customers and partners.
   

  

 This is an exciting opportunity to become part of the EasyPark team as a Software Engineer. You will play a key role in our future success and have a true opportunity to make a real impact and difference for our users and our business!
   

  

**Firstly, a Bit About The Team**
 The team owns a “Leads Engine” system that generates high quality leads using smart distribution and machine learning algorithms and works closely with the Data platform team on a daily basis. This position will mostly work with the team on improving, evaluating and fine tuning the lead’s engine system, the generation and the disruption of data.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Work with the team to create a high-quality and robust lead engine.
* Owning the development process with the team from planning to final delivery.
* Work closely with our product manager, data scientists, and other engineers to ensure high-quality leads generation.
* Work with the team to ensure best practices and code standards are followed.
* Leverage usage data and experimentation to evaluate the performance and impact of our existing features, troubleshoot potential issues, and ideate new hypotheses for further iterations.
* Take an active role in quarterly planning, code reviews, problem solving, code camp and knowledge sharing sessions.


**What You’ll Bring To The Team**
* Problem-Solving: Skilled at addressing complex development challenges with a systematic and efficient approach.
* Collaboration: Communicates effectively and works well in agile, cross-functional teams.
* Team Player: Supports colleagues, provides well-reasoned input, and remains open to diverse perspectives.
* Adaptability: Thrives in dynamic, fast-paced environments and adapts smoothly to changing requirements.
* Detail-Oriented: Focused on code quality, debugging, and thorough testing.
* Innovation & Initiative: Proactively contributes fresh ideas and seeks continuous improvement opportunities.


**Core Tech Requirements** 
  

  

* Technologies: Proficient in Java, Spring Boot, AWS, Kotlin, and Kafka.
* Distributed Systems: Experience in developing and working with distributed systems.
* Architecture Skills: Expertise in designing robust architectural frameworks, including clean architecture (e.g., hexagonal) and knowledge of various technical design patterns.
* Nice to Have:
+ Familiarity with machine learning algorithms and frameworks such as scikit-learn.
+ Experience with data warehousing systems like Snowflake.
+ Hands-on experience in agile development environments.


**What We Offer**
* Flexible ways of working: combine working from home with working from the office, whatever is agreed on within your team.
* Digital global onboarding: three days to indulge in learning & connecting with fellow new starters across the globe.
* Pension, insurances & health reimbursement: A competitive pension, in combination with the basic package of insurances
* Proactive health support: your wellbeing is important to us, which is why we offer proactive medical support, all depending on your need.
* Mental well-being support via Blue Call
* Wellness reimbursement: 5000 SEK/Year

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Do you want to be at the forefront of protecting our society against cyber threats? We are looking for Senior Software Engineer with focus on Java, Linux and Kubernetes to team up with the most dedicated team of cyber specialists in our Secure Development domain.**
**About Truesec – A Leading Cybersecurity Company**
 Since 2005, Truesec has been a native cybersecurity company, driven by one single purpose: Creating safety and sustainability in a digital world by preventing cyber breach and minimizing impact.
   

  

 Over the years, we’ve earned the trust of organizations worldwide and gained a strong reputation internationally. Our team consists of dedicated specialists covering the entire spectrum of cybersecurity – with capabilities in Predict, Prevent, Protect, Respond, and Recover.
   

  

 Today, we employ around 350 employees – and as cybercrime grows, we need to grow. To support that goal, we are now looking for a senior software engineer who wants to create advanced security solutions together with our Secure Development team.
   

  

**Secure Development**
 Applications and custom solutions are currently popular targets for threat actors. In modern application development, security must be present throughout all aspects of the development process. Our engagements span from AppSec-related security workshops, educating organizations in secure coding and DevSecOps, to longer assignments where we write code responsibly as integrated team members. We are a cyber tech company with our own custom software and services that we leverage both during assignments and with our clients. Our assignments requires strong and secure collaboration within the teams. We are very proud about our offices in the central part of Malmö and Stockholm, in which we strive to meet as much as possible and engage in deep technical discussions and several social activities.
   

  

**The Role**
 Together with a team of highly skilled and experienced developers you will design, build and maintain systems that have high expectations on availability, performance and obviously security. We take pride in building some of the most important features and functionalities of our clients systems and with a solid history of several years of delivery. You will be challenged to consider and understand potential threats and vulnerabilities against your code, the overall application and its users. We expect you to appreciate working in a team but also be able to take on tasks and issues individually.
   

  

**Your Potential Background**
 We think that you have a couple of years of building and maintaining Java applications, hopefully feel comfortable in Linux environments and have understanding in the benefits and design of container-based apps with Kubernetes. You talk the talk, and walk the walk, meaning you are passionate about continuously learning new skills while being aware of your own strengths and potential weaknesses, surrounding yourself with peers that fill the gaps and learn from each other.
   

  

**Required Skills:**
* Java EE or Spring
* Linux, RedHat/Ubuntu
* Docker/Kubernetes


**Bonus Skills:**
* Microservices architecture
* Cloud native design and development
* Application Security/threat modeling/vulnerability management


 Due to the sensitivity in our assignments, we require Swedish citizenship, citizenship in an EU country, or a Swedish work permit.
   

  

**Join Our Mission Toward a Safe Digital Future**
 If you truly want to make a difference and make our world a little bit safer, this is the place for you. At Truesec, you'll get to be at the forefront of fighting cybercrime instead of reading about it in the news. This is your chance to be part of an exciting journey in a leading cybersecurity company - and learn from some of the best in their field.
   

  

 So, are you ready to team up with the most dedicated team of experts and be part of a meaningful mission? Then we are excited to get to know you!

title: Embedded SW Developer within R&D - Stockholm
description:
**Job Description**
**Embedded SW Developer within R&D - Stockholm**
 Are you a skilled embedded software developer or proven tester with a passion, mainly but not exclusively, within the Automotive Industry?
   

  

 Then, join our dynamic team and become a driving force behind cutting-edge automotive technology!
   

  

**Here You Can Find**
* Innovative Projects: Dive into exciting projects at the forefront of Automotive development, shaping the future of mobility.
* Top-Notch Tools: Access the latest tools and technologies, empowering you to excel in your craft.
* Collaborative Environment: Work alongside a talented team of professionals, collaborating seamlessly to conquer challenges and achieve excellence.
* Continuous Growth: Fuel your passion for learning with ongoing training and development opportunities.
* Impactful Work: Make a meaningful impact by contributing to the creation of safe, reliable, and innovative automotive solutions that touch lives globally.


**Your Role As An Embedded Software Developer**
 You will focus on developing embedded software, mainly but not exclusively within the Automotive Industry.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities Can Include The Following Tasks**
* Developing software using C and C++ programming languages.
* Use MATLAB and Simulink for modeling and potentially generate C code.
* Write unit tests or other testcases (Python)
* Working with real-time operating systems (RTOS) and embedded Linux or other embedded operating systems.
* Debugging hardware-related programming issues using tools such as JTAG.
* Utilizing version control systems such as Git and CI/CD pipelines.


**Your Profile**
 To be successful in this role, we are looking for an individual who has:
   

  

* At least 5 years of experience with embedded programming in C/C++.
* Experienced in MATLAB and Simulink
* Experience with hardware-related programming and debugging, including JTAG and other debugging tools.
* Knowledge of real-time operating systems (RTOS) and experience with embedded Linux or other embedded operating systems.
* Experience with version control systems such as Git and continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines.
* Excellent writing and verbal English skills
* Bachelor’s or Master degree in relevant field


**Meritorious**
* Experience from Electrical Vehicles
* Experience from Driveline Control Systems
* Experience from Engine Control Modules and Combustion Engines
* Experience from Powertrains
* Understanding of Automotive software development processes, such as Automotive SPICE or ISO 26262.
* Familiarity with Automotive communication protocols such as CAN, LIN, and Ethernet.
* Experience of the consultant role in a European country
* Spoken and written Swedish is meritorious.


**Application and Contact**
 Selection and interviews are running continuously. Apply now to join our team and make a meaningful impact in the automotive industry.
   

  

 For questions and for more information contact Jan Hansson, Talent Acquisition Partner, 0725-616900
   

  

 Kindly note that due to GDPR, we will not accept applications via mail. Please use our career site.
   

  

 We kindly but firmly refrain from direct contact with staffing, brokerage, and recruitment companies as well as other external actors and sellers of additional job advertisements.

title: Fullstack .NET/C# utvecklare
description:
**Bli en del av vårt team som vår första utvecklare - Fullstack .NET/C#** 




 Vi på Elcykelpunkten är stolta över att ha skapat en innovativ plattform för förmånscyklar som revolutionerar hur företag och deras anställda interagerar med förmånen. Nu söker vi en passionerad och erfaren utvecklare som kan vara med och ta vår plattform till nästa nivå.
 



  





**Om oss:** 
 Elcykelpunkten är ledande inom gröna transporter och elcyklar och har utvecklat en banbrytande plattform för att hantera förmånscyklar. Vår plattform integrerar fler tredjepartsprogram som Order management system Omnium, WMS Bitlog, CMS Contentful, och E-handelsmotorn Norce för att skapa en sömlös upplevelse för våra kunder. Utöver detta bygger vi även franchisekedja med 10+ butiker och har en traditionell e-handel som an del av vår verksamhet.
 



  





**Din roll:** 
 Som vår första utvecklare kommer du att vara ansvarig för att utveckla och underhålla integrationer mellan olika system samt skapa effektiva gränssnitt mellan kunder, personalavdelningar och våra interna processer. Du kommer att arbeta med både frontend och backend och behöver god förståelse för systemarkitektur och kodskrivning i C# och .NET. I rollen kommer du även koordinera samarbete med vår byrå för att säkerställa högsta möjliga framdrift i utvecklingsarbetet.
 



  





**Vi letar efter dig som:** 



* Har gedigen erfarenhet av fullstack-utveckling med fokus på .NET och C#.
* Kan arbeta självständigt och i team för att lösa komplexa problem.
* Har kunskap om integrationer mellan olika system och erfarenhet av att bygga gränssnitt.
* Har förståelse för systemarkitektur och kan bidra till att utveckla och förbättra vår plattforms tekniska grund.



  





**Det är meriterande om du:** 



* Har erfarenhet av headless e-handelsplattformar eller B2B e-handel.
* Har kunskap om molntjänster och moderna utvecklingsmetoder.



  





**Vi erbjuder:** 



* En spännande roll i ett snabbväxande företag med möjlighet att påverka och bidra till vår plattforms framtid.
* Ett dedikerat och passionerat team med fokus på innovation och kvalitet.
* Möjlighet till personlig utveckling och kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling.
* Möjlighet att vara med och forma vår inhouse tech-avdelning då vi går från att jobba med externa team till att bygga upp vår egen tech-avdelning.



  





**Sök nu:** 
 Om du är redo att ta nästa steg i din karriär och tror att du är rätt person för denna utmaning, skicka din ansökan redan idag. Vi ser fram emot att få lära känna dig och diskutera hur du kan bidra till vårt team och vår plattforms framgång!
 



  





 Start: Snarast
 



 Anställningsform: Tillsvidare
 



 Plats: Vi sitter i nya lokaler i Hammarby Sjöstad/Gullmarsplan i skrapan Sthlm01.
 



  





 All försäljning från annonssäljare och rekryteringsföretag i samband med denna rekryteringsprocess undanbedes vänligen.

title: Senior front-end utvecklare renodlad i React (STÄNGD)
description:
Vi söker en renodlad senior front-end utvecklare i React till vår e-handel kund som kommer att ansvara över att bygga ett eget UI från grunden.
   

  

**Dina uppgifter**
* Designa och bygga ett helt nytt UI från grunden i React.
* Arbeta med micro-frontends arkitektur i en AWS-miljö.
* Samarbeta nära med vårt back-end team för att säkerställa en sömlös integration av back-end mikrotjänster (node.js) och optimal prestanda.
* Samarbeta nära UI-designer för att tillsammans skapa en riktigt bra design.
* Ta fullständigt ägarskap av front-end projektet, med möjlighet att fatta egna beslut kring design och implementering, så som module federation, state management och andra ramverk.


 Uppdraget är långsiktigt och kommer vara tekniskt utmanande med ständiga förändringar och kontinuerlig utveckling. Du har gedigna kunskaper inom modern systemutveckling och har arbetat med utveckling av SaaS-tjänster i cloudmiljö, ex Azure. Kunden ser helst att du har kunskaper i C#, Java/typescrift och Microsoftstacken.

title: Utvecklare till Business Technology Företagsmarknad
description:
Video Plugin
   

  

**Utvecklare till Business Technology Företagsmarknad**
 Vi söker dig som vill vara utvecklare i något av våra 8 agila team inom Business Technology Företagsmarknad.
   

  

 Ett team består oftast av 3-5 utvecklare, kravställare/testare, Scrum Master och Produktägare. Teamen stöttar Trygg-Hansas företagsaffär med bland annat säkra och kvalitativa lösningar för självbetjäningstjänster, samarbeten och tjänster för externa partners samt digitala säljkanaler.
   

  

 Tjänsten är placerad i Malmö eller Stockholm och resande mellan våra kontor kan förekomma.
   

  

**Din bakgrund**
 För att du ska känna att du är på rätt plats vill vi att du:
   

  

* har arbetat några år som utvecklare
* har mycket goda kunskaper i C#/.NET, ASP.NET
* har arbetat med SQL-databaser (t.ex. Microsoft SQL Server)
* kan hantverket systemutveckling och ser på ditt yrke med stolthet och värderar långsiktighet och kodkvalité
* har erfarenhet av versionshanteringssystem tex Git
* har förmåga att förstå helheten och trivs i att navigera i komplexa miljöer
* trivs med att jobba i team och bidra till teamets leveranser


**Vi Ser Gärna Att Du Har Erfarenhet Av**
* att använda och implementera REST- och Web API:er
* Azure Cloud
* agila arbetssätt som exempelvis Scrum


**Meriterande Om Du Har Erfarenhet Av**
* att jobba med CMS Optimizely och/eller SharePoint
* CI/CD, Kibana, Xunit
* försäkringsbranschen, då det är en komplex domän
* frontend-ramverk exempelvis Vue.js


**Vår arbetskultur**
 Vår kultur bygger på självledarskap, samarbete, tillit och stort personligt ansvarstagande, där du tillsammans med ditt team kan vara med och påverka utvecklingsinitiativ och fatta beslut i vardagen. Målet är att skapa lösningar med hög kvalitet och användarvänlighet.
   

  

 Hos oss blir du en del av ett team med kunniga och nyfikna kollegor och en inkluderande arbetsplats med ett stort hjärta. Vi ska vara en trygg arbetsplats där alla kan vara sig själva. Och så gillar vi att ha kul tillsammans också.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
 Här får du arbeta i gränslandet mellan affär och teknik, vara med och påverka utvecklingsinitiativ och arbeta med hela livscykeln för applikationerna.
   

  

 Vi investerar kontinuerligt i modernisering och arbetar idag både med modern teknik och innovation för att kontinuerligt skapa nya produkter. Vi är i en intressant fas där vi håller på att avveckla våra legacy system och effektivisera vårt sätt att arbeta. Allt för att i förlängningen underlätta för våra kunder.
   

  

 Hos oss är utveckling och lärande något som ständigt pågår – och vi vill att du växer. Här kommer du att ha möjligheten att prova på nya saker och utvecklas i det du tycker är intressant, vi har många karriärvägar och din utveckling är viktig för oss.
   

  

 Vi tror också att ett personligt engagemang är bra både för dig och för företaget och du som anställd bland annat använda några arbetsdagar per år till ideellt arbete.
   

  

 Hos oss finns en flexibilitet när det kommer till kontors- och hemarbete. Här har vi möjlighet att både jobba hemifrån och på ett modernt och lättillgängligt kontor för att träffa kollegor, samverka och nätverka.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Välkommen med din ansökan. Rekrytering sker löpande, och senast den 10. december, så ansök redan idag!
   

  

 Har du frågor om denna möjlighet? Kontakta gärna rekryterande samordnande ledare Head of Busines Technology CL Commercial and Care, Elin Lundström, på elin.lundstrom@trygghansa.se.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Vi undanber oss kontakt från annons-, konsult- och rekryteringsföretag.
   

  

**Fackliga kontaktpersoner**
 Forena: Elias Bakk, 0707-30 68 54
   

  

 Akademikerföreningen: Lena Darin, 070-168 28 44
   

  

 Trygg-Hansa har gjort skillnad i människors liv sedan 1828 och är i dag en del av Tryg-koncernen, Skandinaviens största sakförsäkringsbolag. Som medarbetare på Trygg-Hansa arbetar du med 7 500 engagerade kollegor över hela Tryg-koncernen i Sverige, Norge och Danmark. Tillsammans skapar vi trygghet för livet.

title: UX & Produktdesigner med intresse för AI
description:
AI Sweden, det nationella centret för tillämpad artificiell intelligens, har som mål att accelerera användningen av AI för samhällsnytta, konkurrenskraft och för alla i Sverige.
   

  

**Vi söker nu en erfaren UX & Produktdesigner för projektanställning med start omgående.**
 Om tjänsten
   

  

 Har du erfarenhet av att skapa användarcentrerad design, ett öga för detaljer, och en nyfikenhet för AI? Vill du vara en del av olika projekt som gör skillnad? Då kan det här vara rollen för dig!
   

  

 Vi har i dagsläget två projekt som är i olika stadier av utvecklingsfasen och söker en kollega att ansvara för UX samt produktdesign i dessa. Tanken är att du ska fördela din tid 50/50 i de olika projekten till en början, för att därefter även kunna hoppa in och stötta andra vid behov med digital och grafisk design.
   

  

 Som UX & Produktdesigner hos oss kommer du att spela en central roll i att skapa användarvänliga och tilltalande lösningar. Vi ser helst att du arbetar från vårt Göteborgs- eller Stockholmskontor och är på plats minst 2-3 dagar i veckan, även resor runtom i landet kommer att ingå i rollen.
   

  

 Du kommer att:
   

  

* Genomföra användartester och intervjuer för att säkerställa att våra lösningar möter användarnas behov.
* Bygga och underhålla designbibliotek och arbeta i Figma för att ta fram prototyper och design.
* Bidra med din expertis inom grafisk design för att skapa estetiska och funktionella gränssnitt samt kommunikationspaket.
* Samarbeta nära med produktägare, utvecklare och andra nyckelroller.


 Vi söker dig som:
   

  

* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta i eller med offentlig sektor.
* Är bekväm med och vill ta ansvar.
* Trivs i agila arbetssätt.
* Klarar att navigera i osäkra sammanhang.
* Har förmågan att arbeta både självständigt och i team.
* Är intresserad av AI och gärna har erfarenhet av att använda språkmodeller professionellt eller i egna projekt.
* Kan kommunicera obehindrat på svenska och engelska.


 Ansök nu
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot att fylla denna position så snart som möjligt. Intervjuer kommer att hållas löpande tills vi hittar rätt kandidat. Rollen är en projektanställning till september 2025, med möjlighet till förlängning. Ansök med ditt CV och personligt brev samt portfolio. Vi lägger stor vikt vid din portfolio och de arbeten du kan visa upp och behandlar inte ansökningar utan någon portfolio.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag:
 **måndag 25 November 2024** 
 .
   

  

 Personliga kvaliteter
   

  

 Vi söker någon som gärna vill ta eget ansvar och forma rollen, som kan driva designarbetet framåt, med nyfikenhet, öppenhet och drivkraft. En person som också ser stor potential och värde i AI, som gärna fördjupar sig inom ämnet.
   

  

 Du behöver också älska att arbeta med andra och trivas i en samarbetsmiljö där du inte bara drar nytta av andras kunskaper utan även stärker andra i deras arbete. Du kommer att få jobba nära både Produktägare samt utvecklare och andra kollegor.
   

  

 Problemlösning kommer att vara en del av din vardag och det är viktigt att du är kreativ och kan arbeta individuellt för att hitta konstruktiva lösningar. Viktigt dock att du även vågar be om hjälp när det behövs.
   

  

 Vi tror att mångfald är viktigt för att skapa starka team. Vi välkomnar sökanden med olika könsidentiteter och kulturell bakgrund.
   

  

 Utbildningskrav
   

  

 Examen/Utbildning inom UX, Produktdesign, Grafisk design eller inom annat relevant område. Högre examen är positivt men inte ett krav.
   

  

**Varför arbeta för AI Sweden?**
 AI Sweden erbjuder mycket mer än bara tekniska roller; vi är en plattform för samhällsförändring. Vårt team är mångsidigt och vi erbjuder en unik miljö som främjar personlig tillväxt och innovation.
   

  

 Organisationen verkar i skärningspunkten mellan statligt stödd verksamhet och flexibel startup. Hos oss kan dina idéer leda till inflytelserika projekt.
   

  

 Anslut dig till AI Sweden och bli en del av ett team som sätter trender och formar framtiden för offentliga tjänster med AI-drivna lösningar. Vi erbjuder en plats för personlig och professionell utveckling, där du bidrar till spännande och meningsfulla projekt.
   

  

**En jämställd och rättvis arbetsmiljö**
 Vi tror starkt på mångfald och inkludering och är mycket medvetna om den skeva könsbalansen i vår bransch. Vi strävar aktivt efter att sätta ihop ett mångsidigt team vad gäller ålder, kön och bakgrund.
   

  

 Naturligtvis har vi kollektivavtal och erbjuder allt som följer med vad gäller semester, pensioner, friskvårdsbidrag och sådant.
   

  

 Om du har några frågor eller funderingar, tveka inte en sekund att kontakta Irina Balog eller Jonatan Permert, Produktägarna.
   

  

*AI Sweden ber vänligen att inte bli kontaktade av några reklamagenter, rekryteringsbyråer eller bemanningsföretag.*

title: Software Engineer
description:
*As pioneers and global leader, Hiab is ambitious to write forward our success story, inspiring and shaping our industry. The world in which we operate with our class-leading products, intelligent services and innovative digital solutions is constantly changing.*

  


***Together, we keep everyday life moving to build a better tomorrow.***

  

**Purpose of the position**

  


We are seeking a skilled Simulation Software Engineer to build and maintain software for dynamic simulations with an emphasis on graphic visualization. The role requires experience in developing complex simulations and creating interactive, data-driven visualizations to enhance user insights.

  


**Main tasks and responsibilities**

  


* Develop high-performance simulation software with engaging, intuitive graphics
* Design and implement 2D/3D visualizations to enhance the simulation experience
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align on functionality and user experience
* Continuously improve algorithms and graphical presentations for optimal performance.

  


**What you’ll need to succeed**

  


* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
* Strong programming skills in C#, C++, or Python
* Experience with simulation software development and graphical interface design
* Proficiency with Unity, OpenGL, or Unreal Engine for real-time rendering
* Strong 2D/3D visualization skills and experience with data-driven UI.

  

  

*Preferred Skills:*


* Proficiency in Unity for interactive visualization
* Knowledge of domain-specific simulation techniques (e.g., fluid dynamics)
* Experience with UX/UI design principles for simulation tools.

  


**You will be part of**

  


We offer you a position in a global organization where you are challenged with interesting and diverse tasks. These tasks will provide a great opportunity for you to grow professionally.

  


  

**Interested to join?**

  


If you are excited about this opportunity, please submit your application/ CV in English, until December 20th, 2024. We process applications on an ongoing basis, and the position may be filled before the deadline. We look forward to hearing from you!

  


**Hiab is part of Cargotec**


*Hiab is the world's leading provider of on-road load handling equipment, intelligent services and digitally connected solutions. As the industry pioneer, Hiab's more than 3,300 employees worldwide focus on our commitment to increase efficiency in our customers' businesses and to shape the future of intelligent load handling.*

  


*Hiab's offering encompasses class-leading load-handling equipment, including HIAB loader cranes, LOGLIFT and JONSERED forestry and recycling cranes, MOFFETT truck mounted forklifts, MULTILIFT demountables, and tail lifts under the ZEPRO, DEL, and WALTCO fabrands. Hiab's ProCareTM service, award-winning HiVisionTM crane control system, and HiConnectTM platform demonstrate our constant drive to provide intelligent services and connected solutions that add value to our customers.* *www.hiab.com*

  


*Hiab is part of Cargotec. Cargotec's (Nasdaq Helsinki: CGCBV) sales in 2023 totalled approximately EUR 4.6 billion and it employs around 11,400 people.*

Helsinki, FI - Corporate Office
We have office throughout the US for our three business entities.

title: Digital & Attraction Marketing Manager
description:
**Location:**  

Kungsbacka, SE
  
  

**Job Family:** Marketing
  
**Country/Region:** Sweden
  
  

Are you a hands-on digital marketing professional with a strategic mindset and a passion for driving impactful campaigns and optimizing the customer journey? Coloplast Sweden is looking for a Digital & Attraction Marketing Manager to join our team. In this role, you’ll plan, execute, and manage digital marketing activities to support our marketing and commercial strategies, ensuring a seamless user experience across our digital platforms. You’ll collaborate with cross-functional teams to align global strategies with local needs while staying ahead of the latest digital marketing trends.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

**Strategy Implementation & Execution:** Plan, execute, and optimize digital marketing activities to achieve traffic, engagement, and conversion goals.
  
**Campaign Management:** Develop, launch, and manage digital campaigns across channels, ensuring objectives are met and performance is optimized.
  
**SEO & SEM Optimization:** Execute and adjust local SEO and SEM strategies, including keyword optimization, technical SEO, and Google Ads management.
  
**Content Management:** Create and maintain high-quality, engaging content that aligns with brand guidelines and audience expectations.
  
**Performance Tracking & Analytics:** Monitor digital performance metrics, analyze trends, and provide actionable insights to improve outcomes.
  
**Customer Journey Optimization:** Enhance user experiences by refining the customer journey and addressing gaps in the digital funnel.
  
**Collaboration:** Work closely with the Digital Activation unit at HQ, Nordic teams, and other stakeholders to align on goals and share best practices.
  
**Vendor & Partner Coordination:** Manage relationships with external vendors and platforms to ensure smooth execution of campaigns and activities.
  
**Reporting:** Prepare and present regular reports on campaign performance, key metrics, and recommendations to stakeholders.
  
  

**Your Profile:**  

We’re looking for a self-starter with a strategic mindset and a results-oriented approach. You thrive on working independently while collaborating effectively with teams. Analytical and detail-oriented, you’re skilled at turning insights into actionable strategies.
  
  

**Qualifications & Skills:**  

Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in marketing, digital media, or a related field.
  
Minimum of five years of experience in digital marketing, with proven success in managing campaigns and optimizing digital channels.
  
Proficiency in SEO, Google Ads, and analytics tools like Google Analytics and Tag Manager.
  
Experience in UX and user funnel optimization to enhance the customer journey.
  
Familiarity with creative tools such as Photoshop and InDesign is an advantage.
  
Fluent in written and spoken Swedish and English, with Swedish proficiency suitable for creating professional content.
  
  

**What We Offer:**  

A dynamic and collaborative work environment where your contributions make a direct impact.
  
Opportunities to work on meaningful projects that drive real business results.
  
The chance to shape and enhance digital marketing initiatives at Coloplast Sweden.
  
  

If you’re ready to take ownership of digital marketing activities and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we’d love to hear from you.
  
  

**How to Apply:**  

Submit your CV via our career portal. We’re reviewing applications on a rolling basis, so don’t wait to apply!
  
  

About Coloplast
  
At Coloplast, we’re committed to improving the lives of people with intimate healthcare needs. Coloplast Sverige AB is a subsidiary headquartered in Kungsbacka, just south of Gothenburg. The subsidiary has served the Swedish market for decades and holds a strong position with high ambitions to accelerate growth in the future. The organization consists of 60 dedicated Coloplast employees, all deeply connected to the company’s mission. We are always focused on delivering outstanding results, ensuring customers are served in the best possible way, and continuing to offer innovative solutions.
  
  

We work closely with global teams at Coloplast and are proud to be part of an industry-leading medical device company striving to make a difference for people with intimate healthcare needs.
  
  

Pursuing an ambitious growth agenda, Coloplast develops and markets products and services that make life easier for people with intimate healthcare needs. Employing about 16.000 people and with products available in more than 143 countries, we are one of the world´s leading medical device companies. We are constantly growing our business and always looking for new ways to move forward – we explore, learn and look for new ways of doing things.
  
  

Coloplast is committed to being an inclusive organization, where people bring their differences to work each day, fulfil their potential and have a strong sense of belonging because – and not despite – of their differences. We therefore encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of gender, age, race, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religious belief or physical ability.
  
  

Visit us on Coloplast.com.
  
  

57938
