title: Unit Program Manager
description:
**Software: fuel for mobility**
-------------------------------



**Connected Experience is a unit within R&D which includes Connectivity Platform, Infotainment, Car Cloud and Remote Functions, Vehicle Data- & Diagnostics as well as HW and Mechatronics. The ART Remote Functions contribute to the overall connected experience of our customers. We build, provide, and operate a highly secure run-time ecosystem of products to remotely access the connected cars, including the Volvo Cars mobile app and digital key. Every day we make life less complicated for hundreds of thousands of people by giving them remote access to the car from the comfort of their couch. With the app you can for instance start, heat and prepare the car for your trip by sending your destination to the car, either from your phone, tablet or your watch.**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------



As a Unit Program Manager, you are the driving force behind the Unit's deliverables and releases, serving as the primary interface to Vehicle Programs. You will ensure the alignment of project goals and timelines within your designated Cluster(s) and effectively manage the Unit’s interface to the PMO Cluster Tech Lead.

  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

• Serve as the main point of contact between the Unit and PMO Cluster Tech Lead.  

* Manage all Unit deliveries and releases to the assigned Cluster(s), ensuring timeliness and content alignment.
* Create and maintain a Unit Delivery/Release Plan tailored for each Cluster.
* Report status updates (both internal and external R&D) for the assigned Cluster(s).
* Coordinate and synchronize cross-functional delivery planning.
* Summarize Cluster-specific planning outcomes for streamlined execution.
* Support economic decision-making within the Unit for your Cluster(s).
* Identify, manage, and mitigate risks and dependencies.
* Track and resolve impediments, escalating as necessary.
* Assess resource needs to address critical bottlenecks effectively.
* Collaborate with Unit management, architects, product owners, and other stakeholders to align strategy and execution.
  

  

**About You:**  

• In-House Development Expertise: Proven experience in in-house product development, encompassing both software (SW) and hardware (HW) elements.  

* Quality Assurance Knowledge: Familiar with software development processes and quality assurance practices for both in-house and supplier software.
* Large-Scale Project Management: Experience in large-scale development programs, integrating software, hardware, and mechatronics components.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Comfortable engaging with a diverse range of stakeholders to maintain strong relationships and trust.
* Agile & Project Management Skills: Solid background in project management, with an agile mindset.
* Strong Communication Skills: Clear and confident communicator, both in writing and presentations.
* Technical Understanding: Knowledge of cloud infrastructure, telematics, mobile applications, and embedded development.
* End-to-End Development Process Familiarity: Well-versed in the entire in-house software development lifecycle, from concept through deployment, with an emphasis on quality assurance.

**Volvo Cars – driving change together**
----------------------------------------

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!

title: Compute Sales Specialist
description:
Compute Sales Specialist  


This role has been designed as ‘’Onsite’ with an expectation that you will primarily work from an HPE office.**Who We Are:**


Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.

**Job Description:**

 *HPE (Hewlett Packard Enterprise) is the market leader in the Server market in Sweden. By ongoing innovation, we develop our products and services to meet the demands of our customers in a challenging world of digitalization and AI.*

As a **Compute Sales Specialist** at HPE you are responsible for leading the pursuit for Compute business within an assigned territory. You are specialized on the compute products, solutions, services and software portfolio.


You will collaborate with and support Account Managers, and provide compute expertise within the sales team and to assigned customers. You will drive proactive sales activities to build the pipeline, use specialized knowledge and skills to prospect, qualify, negotiate, and close opportunities.

**How You'll Make Your Mark -**

* Responsible for sales of Compute products and solutions in assigned territory, industry, or customer accounts.
* Seeks out new opportunities through prospecting, industry networking and events.
* Develops pursuit plans and builds and manages the Compute sales pipeline.
* Contributes to proposal development, negotiations, and deal closings.
* Works closely with and supports the Account Manager, providing technical expertise and support. Participates in client engagements for complex solutions in smaller accounts.
* Directs and coordinates supporting sales activities related to pipeline hygiene through account managers, Presales, channel partners and other relevant stakeholders.
* Collaborates across the HPE teams to deliver a consistent approach to developing business, including account planning for end-to-end solutions.
* Assesses solution feasibility from a technical and business perspective to qualify/disqualify opportunities.
* Negotiates profitable deals so that the company can expand opportunities based on the existing business and increase the company's footprint and revenue in compute.
* Drives sales of the Compute portfolio, using strong leadership and initiative to successfully prospect, negotiate and close deals.
* Focuses on and works with the channel to forge relationships, provide enablement of key technologies, and co-sell to end-users.
* Effectively leads, evangelizes, and helps to coordinate Compute marketing campaigns (digital/new techniques) to ensure successful launches and maintenance of campaign momentum, in alignment with the account strategy.
* Acts as a trusted Compute solutions consultant for the slated accounts/region.
* Reinforces and articulates HPE's strategy and portfolio to partners and champions to uncover new business opportunities and contacts, including new logos when appropriate.
* Effectively uses references to craft a story that makes complex technologies seem simple and understandable for the customers.
* Actively generates customer interest and understands the customer's buying trends. Links business and financial benefits with technology offerings. Illustrates the ROI & TCO advantages of HPE offerings for the customer's business.

**About You -**

* University or bachelor’s degree preferred.
* Typically, 7+ years of IT Sales experience.
* Demonstrated achievement of progressively higher quota.
* Ability to interface with diverse business customers.
* Agile and adaptive to changes.
* Proactively striving for improvements and willingness to continues learning.
* Team player with ability to work independently.
* Fluency in Swedish and English is required.


#LI-hybrid

**Additional Skills:**


Accountability, Accountability, Active Learning (Inactive), Active Listening, Assertiveness, Bias, Building Rapport, Buyer Personas, Coaching, Complex Sales, Creativity, Critical Thinking, Cross-Functional Teamwork, Customer Experience Strategy, Customer Interactions, Design Thinking, Empathy, Financial Acumen, Follow-Through, Growth Mindset, Identifying Sales Opportunities, Industry Knowledge, Intellectual Curiosity (Inactive), Long Term Planning, Managing Ambiguity {+ 6 more}**What We Can Offer You:**

**Health & Wellbeing**


We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.

**Personal & Professional Development**


We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.

**Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging**


We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.

**Let's Stay Connected:**


Follow @HPECareers on Instagram to see the latest on people, culture and tech at HPE.

title: Video Editor
description:
About the job*Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact – on our colleagues, partners, customers, and society. Together, we’re pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food, water, and shipping.*  

  

*As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too.*
We are looking for a talented, experienced, and dynamic Video Editor who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment and excels at delivering high-quality work. You will be responsible for global video production that aligns with our brand vision and core narrative, and that helps the business deliver on its targets. As part of our team, you will collaborate with stakeholders across all Alfa Laval divisions in a complex matrix organization.
This role is ideal for someone who can produce quality video content efficiently, but also asks tough questions, challenges vague briefs, and brings structure to the debriefing process — ensuring alignment across all teams. If you are passionate about effective video communication, stakeholder collaboration, and brand integrity, we would love to hear from you.
Key responsibilities:
Creative production: Manage video projects from start to finish, from initial concepts through to final production, post-production, and delivery, ensuring deadlines and quality standards are met. Some projects will involve ensuring new footage is created following quality and brand guidelines, but it will be common to re-work, edit, and optimize existing video material for use in various internal and external channels.
Interpret and execute brand guidelines: Ensure all visual assets and communications reflect the brand’s tone, style, and identity consistently across all platforms.
Stakeholder management: Collaborate with cross-divisional teams in a complex matrix structure, maintaining clear and effective communication with all stakeholders.
Briefing & debriefing: Challenge vague or unclear briefs with thoughtful questions and insights. Lead debriefing processes to ensure all parties are aligned on project objectives, deliverables, and timelines.
Cross-functional collaboration: Work closely with other internal teams to deliver on-brand visual solutions that meet business needs.
Drive creative innovation: Be proactive in suggesting new ideas, creative approaches, and design trends that can elevate the brand.
Expert in Adobe Creative Cloud Suite: Create outstanding videos using Adobe Premiere Pro, Adobe After Effects, and other related video and graphics editing applications.
This is who you are:* 5+ years of relevant, preferably corporate experience in video editing and post-production with an understanding of how to adapt video storytelling to different digital media channels in a corporate landscape.
* Highly collaborative, excellent stakeholder manager across both subject-matter experts and non-experts.
* Skilled and ambitious, with proven experience working within brand guidelines and practical constraints to creative expression.
* Able to also support quality video production at scale, e.g. by enabling others to create specific types of videos, through guidelines, template creation, and training.
* Fluent in English, written and spoken, with attention to quality and clarity of the messages delivered in the end products.


The position will be based in Lund, Sweden.
What’s in it for you?  

We offer a challenging position in a global, open, and friendly environment. Your work will have a true impact on Alfa Laval’s future success. The nature of the job also means that you will cooperate closely with many different parts of our organization, building both a broad business knowledge as well as a global network of colleagues.  

  

Assessment practicalities  

We care about diversity, inclusion, and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioral traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this we apply Pymetrics assessments, and upon application you will be invited to play the assessment games.  

For More Information
David Wittlock, Head of Digital Media, David.Wittlock@alfalaval.com
Anna Åhlin, Talent Acquisition Partner, anna.ahlin@alfalaval.com  

Union information  

Johan Ranhög, Akademikerna, +46 46 2891664  

Stefan Sandell, Ledarna, +46 46 367364  

Bror Garcia Lantz, Unionen, +46 709 366985
We are looking forward to hearing from you soon so send your application without delay, and no later than 8th of December 2024. Selection and interviews will be ongoing continuously.
Please note, applications sent directly via email will be disregarded without notice.
company_description: Alfa Laval is a leading global supplier of products and solutions for heat transfer, separation and fluid handling through our key products – heat exchangers, separators, pumps and valves.

title: Director, Customer Management
description:
**About Us****nShift** is the leading global provider of cloud delivery management solutions (SaaS), we enable the frictionless shipment and return of almost one billion shipments across 190 countries each year. We are headquartered in London and Oslo and have over 500 employees across offices in Sweden, Finland, Norway, Denmark, the United Kingdom, Poland, the Netherlands, Belgium, and Romania.
Our software is used by many of the world leading e-commerce, retail, manufacturing, and 3PL shippers due to us having over 1000 carriers integrated into our platform, nearly 3 times more than our competitors!  

If you buy goods online, there is a strong chance that nShift has powered that delivery, so come and join us as we shape the future of shipping, one frictionless journey at a time.**Purpose of role**
An exciting and career-advancing opportunity for a technically savvy, customer-centric, and solution-focused sales leader to join an expanding international team!
We’re passionate about making shipping easy, through creating a community of connected customers, partners and carriers on a single platform, and are looking for great enterprise sales professionals to help us fulfil our vision and mission. **About you**
To be successful in this role, you should have previous experience selling SaaS solutions in the Lower Mid-Market and SMB segments. You are able to coach and develop a small team of Customer Managers and will use your communication skills to cultivate strong relationships with customers, partners and colleagues. If you are motivated and results-driven, and enjoy working in a team environment, we’d like to meet you.  

  

**Overall responsibility**
The role is responsible for managing a team of Customer Managers focussing on existing customers managing, maintaining existing and growing ARR through a combination of direct sales and e-campaigns across your designated region(s).
This includes hands-on involvement in assisting your team with sales processes to ensure the continuous growth of the company while contributing to developing internal processes and the personal development of team members. **The area of responsibility includes:**
Coaching and recruiting team members
Drive the sales process through targeting opportunities together with your team, prospecting, identifying and qualifying solution matches, conducting software demonstrations, and closing deals aligned to the company standard agreements.
Grow and manage a balanced pipeline across assigned territory and customer base to achieve existing business revenue growth.
Precise forecasting and ensuring a high level of accuracy is maintained in the CRM.
Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending internal educational sessions.
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis.
Identify and feedback on product improvements or new products by remaining current on industry trends, market activities, competitors and account feedback.
Working closely with marketing and professional services to ensure customer satisfaction is at the highest level.
  

**Competence and experience**
2+ years of experience in managing a sales team focused on existing logos
Experience within SaaS, e-commerce, logistics, or carrier networks is a key advantage.
Proven commercial and business acumen, skills to develop business through outbound and inbound opportunities.
Experience in identifying, qualifying, prioritizing, and supporting the closing of business opportunities.
Strong relationship management and networking abilities on different organizational levels, and interest in nurturing and expanding pipeline.
Ability to organize, prioritize and execute various activities and focus areas to maximize growth.
Energetic & proactive approach.
Flexible mindset and can-do attitude: Willingness to adapt to customer and organizational needs.
Track record of achieving quotas & KPIs
Demonstrated success selling to SMB and lower mid-market companies with the ability to navigate and manage sales cycles.
Fluency in **Swedish (or other Scandinavian language) and English** (both written and spoken).
A university degree or equivalent education is an advantage
 **Meet your Manager - Stuart Prouse VP, Customer Management****What do you love about nShift?**
We have a very supportive and collaborative culture where everyone is willing to help you. Everyone is willing to share knowledge and experience to ensure your onboarding is successful and you become “one of the team” quickly.**What difference will this role make to nShift if I join?**
This is a vital role working within the Customer Management team. You’ll be faced with leading an international team managing multiple accounts. Having to help your team navigate through business stakeholders from e-commerce, customer experience, logistics and fulfilment, IT, procurement, no deal or day is boring. You’ll be using your experience to coach your team to become better Customer Managers. Working with key departments internally to ensure a smooth transition for the customer, you’ll build effective relationships with professional services, customer services, product, finance, and marketing.
At nShift, we believe in embracing diversity in all forms and fostering an inclusive environment for everyone, which we believe is essential for our continued success. We're an equal opportunity employer, meaning all applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity, or disability status.

Hybrid Remote

Full-time

title: Senior FPGA Designer
description:
Senior FPGA Designer


Swedium Global is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model. Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.


Location: Sweden


Expected Start date: ASAP


Job Description: FPGA Design Engineer

  

  

The team works within several technical fields of expertise ranging from hardware, embedded SW/HW, FPGA, application SW, lab work and more. Team member competencies complement each other to create a strong versatile team.  

  

We are now looking for an FPGA developer with the following profile:  

  

COMPETENCE PROFILE  

  

• Fluent in Swedish and English.  

  

• Great communication skills, ability and willingness to work remotely via e.g., Microsoft Teams.  

  

• Good and thorough knowledge and experience of VHDL and/or Verilog as well as architectures and tools from Xilinx, Altera/INTEL and/or Lattice.  

  

• Knowledgeable within HDL simulation and test such as VUnit and/or ModelSim.  

  

• GIT  

  

• Python  

  

  

If you have any, some, or all of the following competencies it’s considered advantageous.  

  

• Embedded SW development (C / C++)  

  

• Application SW development (C# / .NET)  

  

• Test and verification  

  

• HW design experience  

  

• HW layout experience  

  

• CAN / Canalyzer  

  

• HiDraw  

  

• Experience of working in a SAFe-organisation

  


You can reach out to us at Pratik.pandey@swediumglobal.com or careers@swediumglobal.com


  
Job Overview


* Location : Ludvika, Sweden
* Vacancy : 1
* Key Skills : VHDL, FPGA

title: Application Specialist (Salesforce)
description:
At Tobii, we want to empower businesses and professionals with revolutionary insights into human behavior using the powers of eye tracking and attention computing. We are already making it, and we want to leverage further. We need people who are modern product thinkers, have an eye for technology, and beyond ready to amaze customers.  

  

Based at our HQ in Stockholm, our new **Application Specialist (Salesforce)** serves as the technical owner of our Sales & Marketing application services, with a primary focus on our CRM system, Salesforce.  

  

**As an Application Specialist** **(Salesforce)****, a week could look like this:**

* Consult business requesters on the best technical solution for their requirements, together with other colleagues at Global IT and consider the bigger picture in the overall system / data landscape and impact on the business
* Resolving incidents, service requests and problems for our business applications as 2nd / 3rd level support
* Collaboration with the IT Core Infrastructure and IT Operations teams to install, configure, maintain, restore, or upgrade business applications
* To prioritize, develop, test, deploy, communicate, and document changes and releases
* Ensuring that application permissions are set up on a need-to-know/use basis and perform access control reviews. Ensure that we have the proper licenses for all our users
* Supporting service owners in defining strategies how to develop our application services further
* Occasionally manage projects and support the rest of the IT team by contributing to projects
* Work together with software vendors or consultants to resolve incidents or change the applications
* Documenting your business applications, ways of working and best practices
* Develop, coordinate, and conduct education for end users, with a focus on how to use our applications

**Our humble expectations from you:**

* Proven experience in Salesforce Sales Cloud and Salesforce Flow
* Very good knowledge of business applications and their system architecture (e.g. CRM, ERP, communication & collaboration tools, HR systems), integrations, processes, best practices.
* Bachelor’s degree preferably in Computer Science, Data Science, Business Intelligence, Information Technology, Economics or similar
* Possess good business analysis skills: identify business requirements, consult stakeholders, find solutions with them
* Have excellent English language skills verbal and written; able to communicate clearly towards users and colleagues within Global IT
* Demonstrate agile way of working and data literacy

**Are you our next Tobiian?**  

We are curious about you! Let us know about your background, experiences and where you’re heading. Due to GDPR, we will only review those applications directed to our career page - so please submit your resume or LinkedIn profile through it!  

  

**Being a Tobiian**  

We believe in diversity and equal opportunity. At Tobii we want you to be yourself and we welcome applicants from all walks of life. It’s all about passion, innovation and making things real. Each day is different here at Tobii, hopefully, this is something that motivates you! We want you to be comfortable at work so come in wearing high heels or flip flops as long as you feel that's who you want to be, we're looking for a good personal fit and believe that diversity is the spice of life!

  



Locations
Sweden
Employment type
Full-time
Flexible work policy
60% at the office 40% your preference

title: Unit Program Manager
description:
**Software: fuel for mobility**
-------------------------------


Connected Experience is a unit within R&D which includes Connectivity Platform, Infotainment, Car Cloud and Remote Functions, Vehicle Data- & Diagnostics as well as HW and Mechatronics. The ART Remote Functions contribute to the overall connected experience of our customers. We build, provide, and operate a highly secure run-time ecosystem of products to remotely access the connected cars, including the Volvo Cars mobile app and digital key. Every day we make life less complicated for hundreds of thousands of people by giving them remote access to the car from the comfort of their couch. With the app you can for instance start, heat and prepare the car for your trip by sending your destination to the car, either from your phone, tablet or your watch.

  



As a Unit Program Manager, you are the driving force behind the Unit's deliverables and releases, serving as the primary interface to Vehicle Programs. You will ensure the alignment of project goals and timelines within your designated Cluster(s) and effectively manage the Unit’s interface to the PMO Cluster Tech Lead.

  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

• Serve as the main point of contact between the Unit and PMO Cluster Tech Lead.  

• Manage all Unit deliveries and releases to the assigned Cluster(s), ensuring timeliness and content alignment.  

* Create and maintain a Unit Delivery/Release Plan tailored for each Cluster.
* Report status updates (both internal and external R&D) for the assigned Cluster(s).
* Coordinate and synchronize cross-functional delivery planning.
* Summarize Cluster-specific planning outcomes for streamlined execution.
* Support economic decision-making within the Unit for your Cluster(s).
* Identify, manage, and mitigate risks and dependencies.
* Track and resolve impediments, escalating as necessary.
* Assess resource needs to address critical bottlenecks effectively.
* Collaborate with Unit management, architects, product owners, and other stakeholders to align strategy and execution.
  

  

**About You:**  

* In-House Development Expertise: Proven experience in in-house product development, encompassing both software (SW) and hardware (HW) elements.
* Quality Assurance Knowledge: Familiar with software development processes and quality assurance practices for both in-house and supplier software.
* Large-Scale Project Management: Experience in large-scale development programs, integrating software, hardware, and mechatronics components.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Comfortable engaging with a diverse range of stakeholders to maintain strong relationships and trust.
* Agile & Project Management Skills: Solid background in project management, with an agile mindset.
* Strong Communication Skills: Clear and confident communicator, both in writing and presentations.
* Technical Understanding: Knowledge of cloud infrastructure, telematics, mobile applications, and embedded development.
* End-to-End Development Process Familiarity: Well-versed in the entire in-house software development lifecycle, from concept through deployment, with an emphasis on quality assurance.

**Volvo Cars – driving change together**
----------------------------------------

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Salesforceutvecklare
description:
Vår kund söker en senior Salesforce-utvecklare med minst 5 års erfarenhet av utveckling på Salesforce-plattformen. Du har djup kunskap om bästa praxis och ramverk för Salesforce-utveckling. Kandidaten ska ha praktisk erfarenhet av ett eller flera av följande områden/kluster - Sales Cloud, Experience Cloud, Commerce Cloud (B2B Commerce).
  
Kandidaten är van att arbeta med Apex (klasser och triggers), Visualforce, Lightning-sidor, Aura-komponenter och Lightning Web Components i sitt dagliga arbete. Du är skicklig på att skriva HTML och CSS för att anpassa lösningen efter kundens design system vid behov. Kandidaten har djupgående kunskap om Salesforce deklarativa verktyg, som Flow Builder, och omfattande erfarenhet av att använda Apex för anpassad kodning, samt förmåga att avgöra när en anpassad lösning ska användas vid designbeslut.
  
Förmåga att bedöma påverkan av nya krav på Salesforce samt alla upp- och nedströmsapplikationer, system och processer.
  
**Kompetenser och erfarenheter:** LWC, CSS, HTML, Javascript.
  
  

Vi erbjuder bra lön och förmåner för rätt person.
  
Om detta låter intressant, och du passar in på beskrivningen - då vill vi gärna prata med dig och berätta mer!
  
Ansök genom att skicka in ditt CV till rekrytering@doerbemanning.se.

title: Specialist, Asset
description:
We are Fortum
  
Fortum is a Nordic energy company. Our purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. We are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and our actions are guided by our ambitious environmental targets. We generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow. Our core operations in the Nordics comprise of efficient, CO2-free power generation as well as reliable supply of electricity and district heat to private and business customers. For our ~5 000 employees, we commit to be a safe, and inspiring workplace. Fortum's share is listed on Nasdaq Helsinki. fortum.com
  
  

Are you passionate about technology and eager to take on new challenges in a dynamic, forward-looking environment? We are looking for a Specialist, Asset to join our expert team in the Asset and Locations IT domain. In this role, you will be developing and maintaining cutting-edge solutions for Asset Management and Geographic Information Services that support our production fleets.
  
  

About the role
  
You will be working within a small team of technology experts In the Asset and locations IT domain. Our team is responsible for developing and maintaining companywide shared solutions related to Asset Management and Geographic Information Services for our production fleets.
  
  

Your primary focus will be on our Maximo Asset Management solution, while also contributing to other key projects. You will design and implement changes in line with our Solution Architecture, ensuring the highest standards of performance and reliability.
  
  

About you
  
As a person you are a curious, forward looking and motivated by change and new challenges. You have structured, solution-oriented and analytical mindset which drives your daily work. You are fluent in English and known for your open, transparent communication style that builds trust and fosters collaboration.
  
  

**To succeed in this role, you have:**  

* A bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Business Administration or related field.
* At least 5 years of firsthand working experience with multi-site, high availability Maximo environments as a Developer or Solution lead.
* The ability to Structure Architecture and facilitate Governance Processes.
* Proven communication and collaboration skills with business and IT stakeholders, and different expert teams.
* A deep understanding of IBM Maximo Asset Management technology, capabilities, and processes.


**Considered as your benefit:**  

* IBM Certified Deployment Professional, Maximo version 7 or higher.
* Experience with various programming languages and methodologies used in Maximo
* Experience working with diverse Integrations.
* Experience of cloud-based implementations.
* Knowledge of architecture description methodologies and techniques
* Working experience/knowledge of other Asset Management solutions.


We Offer You
  
At Fortum, we believe in a better future and want to be involved in shaping it. Our workplace is a safe place, both physically and mentally. You will grow with professional colleagues, being trusted and free to challenge yourself. We offer comprehensive benefits, flexible working hours, and hybrid work model to support your productivity, development and wellbeing. We are committed to build diverse teams where everyone feels included and is treated equally.
  
  

More information about our culture and benefits can be found here.
  
  

Interested?
  
Submit your application by 30.11.2024 at the latest. We start contacting suitable candidates already during the application period. Contact details to union representatives can be found on the bottom of this page.
  
  

To be selected for the position, the applicant must go through background clearance and a health examination including drug testing.

title: Fullstack Engineer
description:
**Job Description**  

We are looking for an onsite Senior Full-Stack Engineer with expertise in backend and frontend technologies to help develop innovative and engaging products.


Your role will be critical in building a comprehensive system that seamlessly integrates physical product projections and interactive digital interfaces. The goal is to create a cohesive experience.  

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**

  

* Strong proficiency in React.JS, JavaScript/TypeScript and NodeJs for building scalable and maintainable frontend experiences.
* Deep knowledge of cloud computing and cloud platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP) to ensure seamless integration of cloud-native technologies.
* Experience with micro-frontend architecture to support modular and scalable application development.
* Proven experience in creating responsive designs for optimal performance across devices.

  

**Please explain how you meet all the requirements** **when applying.**  

  

**Utilization****:** 100**%**  

**Location:** Malmö  

**Period**: 01-12-2024-31-08-2025  

**Last day to apply**: 25-11-2024  

We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

title: Junior Elektroingenjör till Saab Surveillance
description:
##### **Tog du nyligen examen inom elektronik och vill arbeta med elkonstruktion?** **Saab Surveillance** **söker nu en nyexaminerad elektroingenjör med intresse för bland annat kretsteori och design.** **Rollen är kopplad till ett talangprogram som ger dig den ultimata övergången mellan studier och arbetsliv.**

 **Att jobba som elektroingenjör på Saab Surveillance**


Som junior elektroingenjör innebär arbetet hos oss att du kommer att få vara med från koncept och studier till leverans av färdiga produkter. Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer att innefatta hantering av kravanalyser, vara med och analysera lösningar och problem samt konstruera kraftdesign (AC/DC-, DC/DC-lösningar). Vidare kommer du att köpa in och designa kablage, hantera designbeskrivningar och felsökningar samt produktionsstöttning och verifiering.


Produkterna som du kommer att arbeta med har krav på hög tillförlitlighet och ska fungera i alla typer av miljöer, vilket innebär stora mekaniska påfrestningar, varierande temperaturer och miljöer.


Sektionen arbetar agilt med ett scrum-baserat arbetssätt vilket innebär att teamen kan ta egna beslut och arbeta självständigt. Du kommer att ingå i ett tvärfunktionellt team där samarbete blir en viktig del för att nå resultat. Du samarbetar med allt ifrån komponentingenjörer till produktion och inte minst med de andra utvecklingsteamen. Gruppen som du kommer att tillhöra jobbar med kraft och kablage inom markradarsystem, både sjö och land.  

  



**Att vara konsult på Nexer Tech Talent**


Nexer Tech Talent är specialister på att ge unga techtalanger den ultimata starten på arbetslivet. För denna roll kommer du att bli anställd av Nexer Tech Talent men arbeta hos Saab Surveillance på kontoret i Kallebäck med start omgående alternativt enligt överenskommelse. Du kommer även att få ta del av ett skräddarsytt utbildningsprogram där du får möjlighet att utveckla och fördjupa dina tekniska kunskaper i områden som AI, Cloud och cybersäkerhet, men även inom tex. ledarskap och personlig utveckling.


Du kommer att coachas av en mentor hos Saab samt en konsultchef på Nexer Tech Talent. Som konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och bjuds ofta in på gemensamma aktiviteter så som föreläsningar, afterwork och lunchträffar. Efter framgångsrikt genomförande av konsultuppdraget är intentionen att du erbjuds en anställning hos Saab Surveillance.

**Vi söker dig som**

  

* Är i början av din karriär och har en civil- eller högskoleingenjör inom elektronik eller motsvarande
* Har ett intresse för kretsteori/design, omvandlare, filter och realisera elektriska lösningar till schema
* Har goda kunskaper inom elkonstruktion och som person är systematisk och noggrann i ditt dokumentationsarbete
* Är strukturerad, kvalitetsmedveten, drivande och nätverkande
* Gillar att arbeta med omväxlande arbetsuppgifter och föredrar ett teambaserat arbetssätt
* Har Cad-kompetens, gärna Cadence, Mentor, Altium eller liknande


Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid var tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. För befattningar där Saab har krav på säkerhetsklassinplacering kan, i förekommande fall, medföra krav på visst medborgarskap.

**Ansökan**

  

Låter detta som något för dig? Vi arbetar löpande med rekryteringen, så skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt. Om du har du frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen att kontakta Tech Recruiter Johanna Norman på johanna.norman@nexergroup.com


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

 **Om Nexer Tech Talent**

*Nexer Tech Talent är specialiserade på att ge nyexaminerade techtalanger en ultimat start på karriären genom våra ettåriga talangprogram. Vi matchar talangers unika kompetens, personlighet och potential med ett uppdrag hos ett av Sveriges främsta bolag. Uppdraget varvas med en gedigen utbildning, mentorskap och sociala aktiviteter. Nexer Tech Talent ger techtalanger en ultimat övergång mellan studier och arbetsliv och en brant utvecklingskurva mot en lovande framtid. Vi är en del av Nexer Group – ett techbolag med djupa rötter i svenskt entreprenörskap och innovation. Tillsammans är vi över 4500 medarbetare i 14 länder som i mer än 35 år hjälpt våra kunder att ligga steget före både strategiskt, teknologiskt och kommunikativt.*

**Om Saab Survelliance**

*Affärsområde Surveillance erbjuder effektiva lösningar för övervakning och beslutsstöd, och system för att upptäcka och skydda mot olika typer av hot. Produktportföljen omfattar flygburna, landbaserade och marina radarsystem, system för signalspaning och självskydd, ledningssystem samt system för sjöfarts- och flygtrafikledning.*

*Avdelningen Surface Engineering ansvarar för utvecklingen av Saabs ytradarsystem. Sektionen Mechanics & Power ansvarar för utvecklingen av mekanik, kraftsystem och kablage i dessa produkter genom systemutveckling, inköpsstöd, produktutveckling samt integration och verifiering. Sektionens cirka 55 medarbetare är organiserade i agila, tvärfunktionella team.*

*Denna tjänst kräver att du godkänns i en säkerhetsprövning i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen.*  



*Läs mer om Saab Surveillance* *här*

title: Emerging Enterprise Account Executive, Nordics
description:
SLSQ425R934



Databricks operates at the leading edge of the Data Analytics space with a mission to help companies solve the world's toughest problems.



Reporting to the Sales Director for Emerging Enterprise, you will be supported by a team of accomplished big data, AI and industry specialists. Your mission will be to promote the use of Databricks across a select group of small/ medium businesses and mid-market accounts operating in the Nordics. You will be offered huge potential for career progression with the pace of the team's growth.



As an Account Executive at Databricks, you love understanding a product in depth and are passionate about communicating its value to customers and partners. Always prospecting for new opportunities, you will close new accounts while upselling existing accounts. Along with the chance to close exciting deals, we also offer accelerators above 100% quota accomplishment.


**The impact you will have:**

* Assess your territory and develop a successful account execution strategy
* Exceed activity and revenue targets
* Track all customer details including use case, purchase time frames, next steps, and forecasting in Salesforce
* Identify new use case opportunities and showcase value to prospects
* Promote the value of the Databricks' Data Intelligence Platform
* Ensure 100% satisfaction among all customers


**What we look for:**


* Experience penetrating new accounts, executing on first use cases, growing initial consumption and closing deals in a direct sales role
* Experience in relevant software sales development role with consumption sales motion
* Some exposure to software industry and grasp of basic concepts of selling SAAS, Big Data and Business Value
* Basic understanding of the data platform and cloud ecosystems
* Experience exceeding sales targets / quotas
* Success closing new accounts while working on existing accounts
* Passion for cloud technologies
* Bachelor's Degree or relevant work experience
* English is required, Swedish is a plus

**About Databricks**



Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.  

  

**Benefits**  

  

At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks.

  

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**



At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.


**Compliance**


**If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.**

title: Data Scientist
description:
**Position Title:** Data Scientist

**Location:** Stockholm, SE

**About Us:** Join our dynamic team in Stockholm and be a part of Qgroup, a globally renowned consultancy network. At Accelerated Growth, a boutique management consultancy, we pride ourselves on our quality-driven approach, scoring 4.84 out of 5 from our clients. We are looking for innovative minds to join our journey in shaping business futures.

**The Role:** As a Data Scientist, you will be a crucial part of our client-focused team. Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop and implement data models and algorithms to solve complex business problems.
* Collaborate with stakeholders, including business leaders, IT teams, and external partners, to define and deliver data-driven solutions.
* Conduct data analysis and visualization to inform decision-making and strategy.
* Provide strategic guidance on data trends, best practices, and industry standards.
* Lead the development of data pipelines, data warehouses, and data lakes.
* Ensure compliance with data governance, security, and regulatory requirements.
* Support the implementation of enterprise-wide data initiatives, including digital transformation, cloud adoption, and data management.
* Mentor and guide junior data scientists and technical teams.

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in data science, with a focus on large-scale data environments.
* Proven track record of designing and implementing data-driven solutions.
* Strong understanding of data science frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
* Experience with cloud technologies (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud) and hybrid cloud environments.
* Proficiency in data analysis, machine learning, and statistical modeling.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage with stakeholders at all levels.
* Willingness to travel within Europe as needed.
* Fluency in English and Swedish.

**Preferred Skills:**

* Experience with Agile methodologies and project management.
* Familiarity with emerging technologies such as AI, IoT, and blockchain.
* Knowledge of industry-specific regulations and compliance requirements.

**What We Offer:**

* A competitive salary with bonuses and comprehensive benefits.
* Opportunities for professional growth through "The Quest," our unique gamified competence tool and our in-house competence development program.
* Access to summer classes at Haas School of Business, UC Berkeley.
* Biannual round table talks with top managers and Q-day annual meetups in Europe.

**Our Culture:** At Accelerated Growth, we value collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone's contributions are valued.

title: Verksamhetskonsult med inriktning...
description:
**Är du den som ser möjligheterna när andra ser utmaningar? Vi på Innofactor letar efter en problemlösare och projektledare med skarp blick för Dynamics 365 och Power Platform. Hos oss blir du spindeln i nätet – från strategi till förvaltning och vidareutveckling. Vi behöver en engagerad konsult som förstår hur teknik och verksamhet går hand i hand. Är du redo att ta klivet och göra skillnad på riktigt? Välkommen till oss inom Business Solutions på Innofactor.**


Vi söker en driven och erfaren Business Consultant som kan optimera affärsprocesser och ta ett övergripande ansvar för leveranser och kundrelationer.

**Ansvarsområden:**

* Överse teamets leveranser och säkerställa effektiv vägledning och samordning.
* Hantera projektbudgetar, sätta upp roadmap tillsammans med produktägaren (PO) och övervaka resursfördelning och kommunikation.
* Planera leveranser och upprätthålla starka kundrelationer.
* Leda och koordinera agila projekt, säkerställa att alla projektmoment genomförs enligt tidsplan och budget.
* Bidra till teamets kompetensutveckling genom att dela insikter och erfarenheter från dina projekt.

**Som Business Consultant kommer du att:**

* Specialisera dig på att optimera affärsprocesser med hjälp av verktyg inom Power Platform.
* Samla in krav, designa och presentera tekniska lösningar, konfigurera och eventuellt utveckla med low code.
* Samordna med tekniska utvecklare och ha omfattande kundinteraktion för att säkerställa att lösningarna möter affärsbehoven.
* Implementera och förbättra Dynamics CRM och Power Platform-lösningar utifrån kundens behov.


Vi söker dig som har en stark kombination av teknisk kompetens och ledarförmåga. Erfarenhet inom Azure är meriterande och ses som ett plus.

**Har du dessutom några av dessa certifieringar eller är nyfiken på att ta dem?**

* PL-200 (Power Platform)
* MB-210 (Sales)
* MB-220 (Marketing)
* MB-230 (Customer Service)
* Azure Fundamentals (grundläggande Azure-certifiering)
* Projektledningscertifiering (meriterande)

**Är det här du?**  

Vi tror att du har arbetat i minst 2–3 år och har erfarenhet av projekt inom Dynamics och Power Platform. Du har förmodligen påbörjat din resa inom projektledning och arbetar främst agilt. Som person beskriver du dig själv som relationsskapande och du är tydlig i din kommunikation. Du drivs av din inre kompass och känner dig trygg i att fatta beslut men förstår att samarbete med andra är A och O för att nå framgång i projektet


**På Innofactor Norden** arbetar nästan 600 engagerade och professionella experter i Sverige, Norge, Finland och Danmark. Det som förenar oss är vårt intresse för innovation och den senaste tekniken. I Sverige är vi cirka 70 anställda med kontor i centralt i Stockholm samt Göteborg och Malmö. Vi har konsulter som jobbar med Dynamics 365, Power Platform, Cloud, infrastruktur, dataanalytics och AI, cybersäkerhet, Microsoft 365, Azure med mera**.**

Vi är också mycket stolta över våra helt egna produkter.Vi har Sveriges ledande medlemssystem för fackligt ansluta och ett ärendehanteringssystem som är störst inom offentlig sektor i Finland och nu på väg att ta den svenska marknaden med storm.

**Be the real you!**


Vi är stolta över det vi skapar och låter våra medarbetare utvecklas som personer samtidigt som vi levererar högsta möjliga kvalitet till våra kunder. Vår arbetsmiljö stödjer de anställdas personliga utveckling och lärande, en god balans mellan arbete och privatliv.


På Innofactor kan du vara dig själv! Vi förväntar oss inte att alla ska vara likadana, utan behandlar varje Innofactorian som en individ. Vi vet att unika människor är avgörande för att skapa starka, framgångsrika team. Hos oss får du möjlighet att träffa människor från olika team, enheter och länder för att jobba med gemensamma projekt och delta i utbildningar.


Välkommen med din ansökan till Innofactor! **Och du - sök redan idag, vi anställer löpande!**

title: Internship Kista Innovation Park 2025
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

 **We Are KIP!**  

Ericsson Innovation Lab with it’s Kista site Kista Innovation Park is opening the gates for Innovation 2.0 which brings together technology, fun and society in central Kista – a place for all interested in technology, communications, robotics and much more! A place where we meet, exchange ideas, create and challenge the status-quo in a fun and flexible way

 **Do you want to be one of the Interns in our Ericsson Innovation Lab?**  

Interested in working part time, during your studies, as an Intern at the Ericsson Innovation Lab our Innovation Incubator and demo space as part of the Kista Innovation Park (KIP)?

 **What you will do:**

  

Main tasks for our interns will be to participate in Innovation projects and demo events, as well make ideas come to life. As an intern you will spend 1-3 days a week onsite in the Kista Innovation Park in Stockholm where you will be part of a small team consisting of other interns, Ericsson Innovators, and external partners. We gather and drive smaller Proof of Concept activities, build mockups and demo objects that might move further into product development. We work in teams with a startup/agile setup where all are empowered to contribute, share, grow and succeed.  

Our KIP is an arena where we foster innovation, explore, and collaborate with external parties such as Academia and other external companies. KIP projects are early phase concept projects with the goal to educate the public as well explore technology possibilities outside its borders.

  

Examples of areas for ongoing projects:

* IoT for Smart City, Sustainability, and remote monitoring
* Explore AI/ML opportunities
* 5G Race Cars setup and project extension
* Robotics
* Investigate new 5G Use cases
* Various AR, VR and XR applications and use cases
 **The skills you bring:**

* Students with that “Maker Space Gene”
* Interested in early demo and proof of concept development
* Interest and capability to work in startup company fashion
* Keen on IoT and connect everything that might benefit from being connected
* Interest in Automation, Cloud Computing, Artificial Intelligence, Virtual Reality, User Interface, Linux, Networking
* Development and hacking experience playing with hardware (Arduino or Raspberry Pie etc.)
* Learn and build mockups and MVPs (Minimal Viable Products)
* Genuine interest in working with people, team player, sharing ideas and feedbacks
* B.Sc., M.Sc. students (min. year 2), D, IT, Y, I, U, MediaTek
 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: Test Engineer
description:
**Why look for a job when you can look for a purpose?**
-------------------------------------------------------

  

  

A job with purpose is more than just a job. After all, your next move determines your everyday life. So what about creating positive change? What about impacting your future and that of millions of others in ways you may never have imagined? Curious? We hope so.

  


**Who We Are**
--------------



The Connected Experience organization within Volvo’s R&D department encompasses Remote Functions, Connectivity and Car Cloud Platform, Infotainment Platform, Applications, and Data & Diagnostics. Our vision is to enhance the appeal of owning a Volvo by connecting all vehicles and providing a continuously enriched experience for both new and existing cars.

  

  

Our Agile Release Train (ART) for Remote Functions is part of the Car Cloud Platform and Remote Functions department, with a mission to enable a seamless global connected experience. We develop and maintain a secure ecosystem for applications and functions that enhance the lives of connected car users. Through innovative technology from the Car Connectivity Consortium® and advancements in cloud services and phone integration, we’re pioneering new connected experiences, transforming how users interact with their cars.


**What You'll Do**
------------------



In this role, you’ll be a key player in the development of digital key technology, where the phone becomes the primary key to the car. Ensuring the highest standards of quality and stability is critical to the success of this endeavor. As a Tester, you’ll collaborate closely with our development teams and existing testers to perform both manual and automated testing of embedded software within our Continuous Integration (CI) environment.  

  

  

You’ll test systems involving embedded software, hardware, and wireless cloud connections, using real mobile devices and cars. This position offers hands-on experience with innovative test scenarios, including approach scenarios, which are a fun and exciting part of our future development. Travel may be required.


**Who You Are**
---------------



You bring 5-10 years of experience as a skilled tester with a background in manual testing of both hardware and software. Automation is a field you appreciate and see as a valuable part of the testing process. You possess relevant qualifications in testing, and you understand the importance of exploratory testing. In our tech-intensive environment, you’ll focus on user experience while executing test plans with precision and meeting deadlines.  

  

  

Your personal qualities include meticulous attention to detail, strong communication skills, and a collaborative, goal-oriented approach to your work. Structured and analytical, you thrive in a fast-paced, result-driven setting, and you’re ready to be part of our journey toward a connected future.


**Ready to Take the Next Step?**
---------------------------------

  

  

Please submit your application through our career page. Due to GDPR regulations, we’re unable to store or consider applications from other platforms. Make sure to submit your application in English.


If you have any questions about the recruitment process, you are welcome to reach out to Recruiter Oskar Nätt at oskar.natt@volvocars.com. For specific questions about the position, please reach out to Hiring Manager Peter Nyberg at peter.nyberg.2@volvocars.com.

  



**Volvo Cars – driving change together**
-----------------------------------------

  

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive working environment. Today, we’re one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, so you can reach your fullest potential.


And it’s so exciting – we’re well on our way on our journey towards full electrification. We have five fully electric cars already on the market, and five more on the way. Our fully-electric and plug-in hybrid cars combined make up almost 50 per cent of our sales. So come and join us in shaping the future of mobility. There’s never been a more rewarding time to play your part in our inspiring and creative teams!
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Head of Growth Marketing
description:
### **SUPPORTING THE GROWTH OF B2B SUBSCRIPTION COMPANIES**


More and more businesses are starting to understand the benefits of recurring revenue with a subscription-based business model, leading to predictable revenue, scalability, and improved customer relationships. However, as a subscription business grows, its readiness to scale is often low. Younium was founded because of the demand in the market for a robust cloud app for B2B companies to handle advanced B2B subscriptions and, in turn, manage financial operations and reporting.


#### **We are Younium!**


Younium is a dynamic, fast-growing company that has moved beyond its start-up phase and is now in an exciting period. We have seen 23 quarters of revenue growth in a row and are now speeding up our international expansion.


Join an energetic and collaborative workplace where creativity, transparency, and individual ownership drive us forward.


With offices in Amsterdam, Stockholm, Malmö, Krakow, and Philadelphia - our team spirit knows no boundaries!  

  



We are looking for an innovative and adaptable Head of Growth Marketing to lead all aspects of marketing and demand creation across North/West Europe and North America. As an inspiring leader for our hybrid/remote team, you’ll combine strategic thinking with hands-on execution — and if processes are missing, you’ll create them!


You’ll report to the VP of Marketing, and this role offers the opportunity to make a big impact on our growth.  



  

**What You’ll Do:**


Lead marketing initiatives to meet revenue goals and accelerate growth.


Build and grow a global Demand Generation team (currently six people, including one Website Manager).


Equip your team with the tools and guidance for success as they grow at Younium.


Together with Demand Gen Managers work on go-to-market planning, pipeline marketing, lead management, and data analysis.


Collaborate with the VP of Marketing on planning, budgeting, metrics, and reporting.


Manage forecasts and proactively address risks with Sales leaders.


Partner with Product Marketing to take the potential customer longer on the journey without sales hands involved.


Work cross-functionally with Product, Sales, and Customer Success to position Younium as the single platform for B2B companies to operate, develop, and expand their servitized business globally.

**Required Skills & Experience:**


Extensive experience in B2B marketing, including at least 3 years in Leadership.


International experience working towards markets outside the Nordics, preferably the UK, Germany, or the US.


Strong background in Performance Marketing, developing KPIs and marketing attribution models. Proficiency in Hubspot, Dreamdata, and knowledge of AI (marketing) tools is a must!


Highly analytical, with a data-driven decision-making mindset.


Solid understanding of the subscription-based business model and experience growing a customer base from 200 to 1000 in a longer sales cycle with larger deals.


Proven success in managing budgets between 1.5-4 million Euros, always with a focus on measurable ROI.


Relevant university degree or similar higher education.

  


##### **Our team**


We are a team of 65 people working from Stockholm, Malmö, Amsterdam, Philadelphia, and remotely. We have clear responsibilities and defined ownership, but with a mindset to collaborate and help each other throughout the team. There are plenty of opportunities and room to grow, a belief in inclusion, and allowing people to grow, learn, and contribute. We have sustainable working conditions and work-life balance through the ability to do remote work and flexible working hours. Ultimately, our ongoing quest is to have fun in everything we do at work and outside!

 *starting date for this position will preferably be ASAP.*

*Please note that we do not offer any relocation package, nor will we recruit outside of Europe for this position.*


We can hire in Sweden and the Netherlands, meaning you need a work permit here. We aren't limited to these countries; having an agreement as a full-time consultant or employed by a third-party partner is also possible if you are based in another European country. As we are a global company with hybrid/remote setup, you are expected to travel approximately. 3-4 days/quarterly, mainly within Europe but also to the US.

title: Production Development Specialist
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**


In this role, you will be part of our production development team, supporting the production and managing the production implementation of the world’s largest transformers. Working in production development provides a chance to get a broad knowledge of our unit and products. You will lead projects that involve many internal disciplines, suppliers and be responsible for all the project phases and budget. You will work at production development Transformers on a strategic level. Focusing on supporting and develop production and you will be living Hitachi Energy core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues.

**How you´ll make an impact**

* Develop and implement production processes and workflows.
* Analyze production data to identify areas for improvement.
* Collaborate with engineering and quality teams to ensure product standards are met.
* Troubleshoot production issues and implement solutions.
* Conduct regular reviews of production processes and recommend enhancements.
* Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies.
* Lead production development projects.
* Support and help our transition to more digital and automated production methods and processes.
* Work closely with colleagues, internal experts, and suppliers to solve production challenges.

**Your background**

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Manufacturing, or a related field.
* Proven experience in production development or a similar role.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Proficiency in production software and tools.
* Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects.
* Fluency in English is a must while knowledge of Swedish is a plus.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**


Are you ready for a new exciting challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!


More information: Recruiting Manager, Sofie Jansson, SOFIE.JANSSON@hitachienergy.com will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Håkan Blomquist, +46 107-38 31 52; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43; Unionen: Tomas L. Gustafsson, +46 107-38 27 47. All other questions can be directed to Talent Acquisition Partner Tobias Nilsson, tobias.n.nilsson@hitachienergy.com.

title: Factory System Test Lead
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**


At Hitachi Energy, we are a leading innovator in HVDC installations, dedicated to delivering exceptional solutions and services to our clients worldwide. With a presence in over 200+ countries, our diverse team of professionals is committed to excellence, collaboration, and continuous improvement. We are proud of our rich history of success and our forward-looking approach that keeps us at the forefront of this industry.


We are now seeking a dynamic and driven Factory System Test Lead to join our professional team. If you are passionate about HVDC technology, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and eager to make a significant impact, we want to hear from you!


We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even though you don’t meet all requirements.

**How you´ll make an impact**

* Responsible for developing test strategies
* Manage the planning and execution of testing activities
* You will perform quality control and assurance
* You will have team management
* You will ensure compliance and standards
* Living Hitachi Energy's core values of safety and integrity means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business

**Your background**

* A bachelor's degree in STEM fields is essential
* You have knowledge of software tools and programming languages used in control systems PLC, SCADA, DCS
* It is an advantage if you have understanding of protection principles, relay coordination, and fault analysis in HVDC systems or equivalents
* You have excellent verbal communication skills that will allow you to report effectively and collaborate with internal and external stakeholders
* Proficient in both English and Swedish, with speaking and writing skills in both languages

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement.
* Flexible working time.
* Health care and wellness allowance.
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally.
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase.
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development.
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden.
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave.
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks.

**More about us**
